data.title: C.S. Lewis and the Love of Words
data.meta_description: What are some of the ways that C.S. Lewis played with and thought about words? C.S. Lewis was warned as a young scholar "never to trust a philologist." At its root, a "philologist" is a lover of words. On that score, at least, Lewis was one of the great popular figures of the 20th century.
